review.title: A note on the uniqueness of models in social abstract argumentation
review.abstract: Social abstract argumentation is a principled way to assign values to conflicting (weighted) arguments. In this note we discuss the important property of the uniqueness of the model.

metadata.title: A note on the uniqueness of models in social abstract argumentation

sections.text: In addition, the model is the subject of in-depth algorithmic investigation and experimental evaluation [CCL14], which shows that instances of significant size encompass both aspects of the structural interaction between arguments (attacks) and coordination with those arguments. Furthermore, the model is the subject of in-depth algorithmic investigation and experimental evaluation [CCL14], which show that a societal abstract framework of argumentation is called a triple < A, R, V >, where a set of arguments stands for a set of arguments, R. "
